inputs.description: Use METHOD to open FILES. Acceptable values for METHOD are: editor: Open with text editor. downloader: Fetch with wget or curl. browser: Open in browser afni: Open with AFNI suma: Open with SUMA 1dplot: Open with 1dplot ExamineXmat: Open with ExamineXmat iviewer: Open with image viewer afniweb: Get from afni website. readme: Search for appropriate README This option is in the same spirit of apsearch -view_readme option. To see a list of all readme files, run: apsearch -list_all_afni_readmes
inputs.name: W

inputs.description: Same as -w editor
inputs.name: E

inputs.description: Same as -w downloader
inputs.name: D

inputs.description: Same as -w ExamineXmat
inputs.name: X

inputs.description: Same as -w browser
inputs.name: B

inputs.description: Same as -w readme
inputs.name: R

inputs.description: Same as -w afniweb  If no method is specifed, the program tries to guess from the filename.
inputs.name: AW

inputs.description: Show help for global options.
inputs.name: GLOBAL_HELP

inputs.description: Show help for global options.
inputs.name: GOPTS_HELP

inputs.description: You're looking at it.  Global Options: ===============
inputs.name: HELP

inputs.description: Mini help, at time, same as -help in many cases.
inputs.name: H

inputs.description: Open help in text editor. AFNI will try to find a GUI editor
inputs.name: H_VIEW

inputs.description: on your machine. You can control which it should use by setting environment variable AFNI_GUI_EDITOR.
inputs.name: HVIEW

inputs.description: Open help in web browser. AFNI will try to find a browser.
inputs.name: H_WEB

inputs.description: on your machine. You can control which it should use by setting environment variable AFNI_GUI_EDITOR.
inputs.name: HWEB

inputs.description: Look for lines in this programs's -help output that match (approximately) WORD.
inputs.name: H_FIND

inputs.description: Help string unedited
inputs.name: H_RAW

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx loveliness, but do not try to autoformat
inputs.name: H_SPX

inputs.description: Help string in sphinx with autoformatting of options, etc.
inputs.name: H_ASPX

inputs.description: Try to identify all options for the program from the output of its -help option. Some options might be missed and others misidentified. Use this output for hints only.
inputs.name: ALL_OPTS

inputs.description: Overwrite existing output dataset. Equivalent to setting env. AFNI_DECONFLICT=OVERWRITE
inputs.name: OVERWRITE

inputs.description: Zero out uncommented text in 1D file. Equivalent to setting env. AFNI_1D_ZERO_TEXT=YES
inputs.name: OK_1D_TEXT

inputs.description: al: Set environment variable 'name' to value 'val' For example: -DAFNI_1D_ZERO_TEXT=YES
inputs.name: DNAME

inputs.description: Print value of environment variable 'name' to stdout and quit. This is more reliable that the shell's env query because it would include envs set in .afnirc files and .sumarc files for SUMA programs. For example: -VAFNI_1D_ZERO_TEXT=
inputs.name: VNAME

inputs.description: Do not read the afni resource (like ~/.afnirc) file.
inputs.name: SKIP_AFNIRC

inputs.description: Output a full dset from node 0 to MAX_NODE-1 ** Instead of directly setting NODE to an integer you can set NODE to something like: ld120 (or rd17) which sets NODE to be the maximum node index on an Icosahedron with -ld 120. See CreateIcosahedron for details. d:DSET.niml.dset which sets NODE to the maximum node found in dataset DSET.niml.dset. ** This option is for surface-based datasets only. Some programs may not heed it, so check the output if you are not sure.
inputs.name: PAD_TO_NODE

inputs.description: Does absolutely nothing but provide for a convenient way to tag a process and find it in the output of ps -a
inputs.name: PIF

inputs.description: Echos the entire command line to stdout (without -echo_edu) for edification purposes   ++ Compile date = Sep  7 2018 {:}
inputs.name: ECHO_EDU
